faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.a1: There are two types of paywalls: hard paywalls and soft paywalls. Hard paywalls don't expose content to the client until you subscribe, so they can't be bypassed with traditional methods. Most sites use soft paywalls, where content is accessible but blocked by popups or only exposed to certain user agents like Googlebot. SMRY tries multiple methods: directly fetching from the original URL (smry-fast), a proxy (smry-slow), and fetching from Wayback Machine archives. We make all requests in parallel to save you time.
faq.q2: How do I know if content can be bypassed?
faq.a2: If a site needs to show content to search engines for SEO, it likely uses a soft paywall that can be bypassed. If some content is visible but part is obstructed, it's often a soft paywall. If no content is visible at all, it's likely a hard paywall. Hard paywalls are common for subscription services like Patreon, OnlyFans, or download-only content. If SMRY or other bypass tools don't work, that's a strong sign it's a hard paywall.
faq.a3: SMRY tries multiple sources in parallel: directly fetching from the original URL (smry-fast), a proxy (smry-slow), and fetching from Wayback Machine archives. We make all requests in parallel to save you time. We also show you which source successfully provided the content, so you can try different options if one fails.
faq.a4: Yes! SMRY is completely open source. You can view the code, contribute, or run your own instance at
faq.a5: Summaries are generated in seconds using AI. We cache summaries to provide instant results for articles that have been summarized before.
faq.q6: What languages are supported for summaries?
faq.a6: Summaries are available in 8 languages: English, German, Spanish, French, Portuguese, Dutch, Chinese, and Japanese. Select your preferred language when generating a summary.
faq.q7: Is there a limit to how many summaries I can generate?
faq.a7: Yes, to ensure fair usage, there are rate limits: 20 summaries per day and 6 summaries per minute per IP address.
faq.a8Option1: Prepend {code} to the article you're reading (for example: {example}). This instantly opens the cleaned article and the summary builder.
faq.a8Option2: Paste a URL directly on smry.ai and we'll fetch it for you.
faq.a8Option3: Drag the bookmarklet on our homepage to your bookmarks bar; tapping it wraps whatever page you're on in SMRY.
faq.q9: Does this work with all websites?
faq.a9: SMRY works with most websites that use soft paywalls. Hard paywalls (like Patreon, OnlyFans, or sites that require login to download files) cannot be bypassed. We use multiple content sources in parallel to maximize success rates across different types of paywalls.

changelogEntries.entryExport_change1_text: Export full articles to your knowledge base
changelogEntries.entryExport_change1_detail: Save any article to Notion, Obsidian, or Roam Research with one click — complete with title, author, date, and full text. Your reading never stays trapped in a browser tab again.
changelogEntries.entryExport_change2_detail: Export articles as clean Markdown files or structured JSON for your own tools and workflows. Obsidian exports include YAML frontmatter, Roam exports use native [[page links]] and attributes.
changelogEntries.entryExport_change3_detail: Every format supports both clipboard copy and file download. Paste directly into your app or save for later — accessible from the share menu on any article.
changelogEntries.entryHighlights_change1_detail: Select any text to instantly highlight it in one of 5 colors. Add notes, change colors, or delete — your highlights stay exactly where you left them, even after you close the page.
changelogEntries.entryHighlights_change2_detail: All your highlights in one place. Filter by color, tap any highlight to jump straight to it in the article, and manage everything from a clean sidebar on desktop or a native-feeling bottom sheet on mobile.
changelogEntries.entryHighlights_change3_detail: Take your highlights anywhere. One-click export to Notion, Obsidian, Roam Research, Markdown, or JSON — formatted and ready to use in your workflow.
changelogEntries.entryHighlights_change4_detail: Highlight a passage and tap "Ask AI" to instantly start a conversation about it. Get explanations, summaries, or deeper analysis without leaving the article.
changelogEntries.entryHighlights_change5_detail: Your highlights sync automatically across all your devices. Start reading on your phone, pick up on your laptop — every highlight and note is right where you left it.
changelogEntries.entrySidebar_change1_detail: Access view modes, AI chat, style options, and sharing from a persistent toolbar — no more hunting through menus.
changelogEntries.entrySidebar_change2_detail: Switch between chat and history in one place. Your conversation stays intact as you browse.
changelogEntries.entrySidebar_change3_detail: Native-feeling drawer navigation with larger touch targets. Customize everything without leaving your article.
changelogEntries.entrySidebar_change4_detail: 7 fonts including OpenDyslexic, adjustable size, spacing, and width. Preferences save automatically.
changelogEntries.entrySidebar_change5_detail: Light options: White, Sepia, Paper, Dawn. Dark options: Carbon, Black, Winter, Forest.
changelogEntries.entryDesign_change1_detail: New default light theme designed for extended reading. Soft cream backgrounds with warm sepia-toned text feel like quality book paper — comfortable for hours without eye strain.
changelogEntries.entryDesign_change2_detail: Redesigned dark mode built for nighttime reading. Rich charcoal backgrounds paired with warm cream text reduce eye strain and help you read longer after dark.
changelogEntries.entryDesign_change3_detail: Warmer, softer tones throughout the app. Article text is now optimized for long-form reading with carefully tuned contrast that's easier on the eyes.
changelogEntries.entryDesign_change4_detail: New icon set with crisper details and better visual weight for a more polished experience across the app.
changelogEntries.entrySync_change1_detail: Your chat history syncs automatically. Sign in to access your conversations from any device and never lose an important conversation again.
changelogEntries.entrySync_change2_detail: Conversations are intelligently grouped into Pinned, Today, Yesterday, Last 7 Days, Last 30 Days, and Older. Pin important chats, rename threads, search your history, and see relative timestamps at a glance.
changelogEntries.entrySync_change3_detail: New scroll-to-bottom button for long conversations and floating input for better accessibility.
changelogEntries.entrySync_change4_detail: Redesigned mobile chat drawer with smoother navigation, better touch targets, and optimized keyboard handling.
changelogEntries.entry0_change1_detail: Introducing conversational AI for articles. Instead of a one-way summary, you can now ask questions, request explanations, and dive deeper into any topic. It's like having a research assistant for everything you read.
changelogEntries.entry0_change3_detail: Watch AI responses appear word by word. No more waiting for the full answer — start reading immediately as the response streams in.
changelogEntries.entry0_change4_detail: Not sure what to ask? Start with one-tap suggestions like "Summarize this" or "What are the key points?" to get the conversation going.
changelogEntries.entry1_change1_detail: Articles are now automatically fetched from the best available source. The system races multiple sources and picks the one with the most complete content.
changelogEntries.entry1_change2_detail: Content may be updated in real-time when a longer, more complete version is found from another source.
changelogEntries.entry1_change3_detail: New richer loading skeleton and compact error display with streamlined retry options.
changelogEntries.entry1_change4_detail: Manual source selector is now hidden when auto-fetch is used. Mid-article and footer ad slots for less intrusive placement.
changelogEntries.entry1_change5_detail: Fixed horizontal scrolling issues on mobile devices. Cards and ads now scale properly on all screen sizes.
changelogEntries.entry2_change1_detail: Switch languages directly from the reader view without returning to the homepage.
changelogEntries.entry2_change2_detail: Language switching now works reliably across all pages and preserves your current article.
changelogEntries.entry2_change3_detail: The keyboard no longer auto-opens on mobile when visiting the homepage, avoiding an annoying UX issue.
changelogEntries.entry3_change1_detail: Premium users now get summaries powered by Claude 3.5 Haiku, Gemini 3 Flash, and GPT-5 Mini — higher quality and more accurate than free-tier models.
changelogEntries.entry4_change1_detail: See whether each source successfully retrieved the full article, got partial content, or was blocked.
changelogEntries.entry5_change1_detail: SMRY is now available in English, Spanish, German, Portuguese, Dutch, and Chinese.
changelogEntries.entry5_change2_detail: Track and search through your reading history. Pro users get unlimited history with full-text search.
changelogEntries.entry6_change1_detail: Articles are now fetched from multiple sources simultaneously, reducing load times and improving bypass success rates.
changelogEntries.entry7_change1_detail: Get AI-generated summaries of any article in seconds, available in 8 languages. Premium users get unlimited summaries.
changelogEntries.entry7_change2_detail: One-click copy articles as clean markdown for ChatGPT, Claude, or other AI assistants.
changelogEntries.entry8_change1_detail: Better handling of soft paywalls that use JavaScript to hide content after page load.
